p: β-1,3-glucanase activity was measured according to the method of De la Cruz et al. (1995). The reaction was started by mixing 200 µl of the supernatant and 200 µl of laminarin (1 mg ml −1). The mixture was incubated at 37 °C for 30 min, followed by the addition of 2 ml of dinitrosalicylic acid (DNS) reagent (Sangon Biotech Co., Ltd., Shanghai, China), then boiled for 5 min. Enzyme and substrate blank were also included. The absorbance of the obtained solution was recorded at 600 nm. A standard curve was established with 0 to 80 mg ml −1 glucose. A unit of β-1,3-glucanase activity was defined as the amount of enzyme catalyzing the release of 1 µmol of glucose equivalent per minute.
